did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Correspondence with Ricker Van Metre, president of the Wyoming Tie & Timber Company, and newspaper clippings on Martin Olson, the Tie Hack Memorial near Dubois, Wyoming, and the railroad tie-cutting industry.

bioghist.head: Biography of Martin Olson
bioghist.p: Martin Olson (b. 1880) came to Wyoming from his native Norway in 1898. He worked in lumber camps in southern Wyoming and was employed by the Wyoming Tie & Timber Company in Riverton and Dubois, Wyoming, from 1916 to 1947. He served as a Fremont (Wyoming) County commissioner from 1954 to 1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence with Ricker Van Metre, president of the Wyoming Tie & Timber Company, and newspaper clippings on Martin Olson, the Tie Hack Memorial near Dubois, Wyoming, and the railroad tie-cutting industry.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Martin Olson as of the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The material was received from Mrs. Martin Olson in 1971.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Roger Simon, February 2019. Finding aid created by Roger Simon, February 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.subject: Tie hacks -- Wyoming -- Fremont County.
Railroad ties.
Memorials -- Wyoming -- Fremont County.
County council members -- Wyoming -- Fremont County.
Tie Hack Memorial (Dubois, Wyo.)

note.p: Includes letters to Olson, letters to and from Ricker Van Metre, who was president of the Wyoming Tie and Timber Company, and letters from E.L. Miller, a forest supervisor at the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and F. Alton Wade, a professor in the Geology Department at Miami University (Oxford, Ohio) regarding the use of the DuNoir site in Wyoming as a geological field camp. Also includes “proposed division of assets and liabilities between company and buyer” for Du Noir Mercantile Company, an “extract from address of welcome to the Railway Tie Association” by E.S. Pennebaker, manager at the Texas Pacific-Missouri Pacific Terminal Railroad of New Orleans, and a balance sheet for Wyoming Tie & Timber Company.
Photographic copy of a 1938 “supplement” of the newspaper the Riverton Review. Includes a photo of Olson.
